title: Heat absorbed by CO and C reaction

content.description: <math alttext="2 C O gas plus C gas react to produce C 3 O 2 gas. delta H naught equals 127.3 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>C</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="2.0em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>127.3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The equation shown above represents an endothermic reaction between <math alttext="C O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the amount of heat absorbed when <math alttext="1.00 mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> reacts with an excess of <math alttext="C gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
